def.dt: :a chemical with a sour taste that forms a salt when mixed with a base count the acids in your stomach noncount the kinds of acid found in your stomach An acid has a pH of less than 7. Very strong acids are able to burn holes in things. compare base 6 ph
:lsd His friend dropped acid [=took LSD] at the concert.

:of, relating to, or having the qualities of an acid He washes his windows with an acid solution of vinegar and water. an acid [=sour] taste This kind of plant grows well in acid [=acidic] soil. Their pizza gives me acid indigestion. [=a burning feeling in the stomach]
:sharp, strong, and critical in tone He made some very acid [=biting, caustic] comments. acid remarks

utxt.vi: They measured the acidity of the soil.
the acidity [=tartness, sourness] of lemon juice
She acidly refers to her former husband as “that little man.”

def.dt: :rain that contains dangerous chemicals because of smoke from cars and factories trees damaged by acid rain
:a difficult situation or task that shows if someone or something is good enough to succeed The new team faced its first acid test when it played the national champions. compare litmus test
:any one of many acids that occur naturally in living things and that include some which form proteins
:an acid that occurs naturally in the juices of oranges, lemons, limes, etc., and that can also be made from sugar
:an acid that is naturally in fats and various oils
:a strong acid that is used especially in scientific experiments and in manufacturing
:a chemical produced by the body in your muscles during exercise
